page.title: 03Shepherd's year
page.content: In the spring of a shepherd's year the main activity is lambing.Ewes often have singles and twins and sometimes triplets and quads.Sometimes lambs can be born backwards and if you don't get there in time the lamb usually dies. The next job is to dip them for ticks.Ticks can get into the lambs blood and if it gets too bad the lamb dies.So we dip them and that kills the ticks. Shearing is an important thing not many people shear.You have to book the shearers.We shear sheep so they don't get too hot in the Summer.The wool is sold for making into clothing. In the Summer the fat lambs are sold for meat.Some ewe lambs are kept for lambing next year.
